column4: hello, I just upgraded from 7.10 to 8.04 and my network no longer works
we need more details to help
thanks, it's an IBM T23 laptop and the wired ethernet controller is an intel 82801CAM (ICH3) pro/100 VE ethernet controller rev 42
Most intel network controllers should be supported, so I think it is eth0. *:avahi are only for the avahi daemon and don't really do anything that could break the network
no, sorry. The network manager not finding your card confuses me
the sigsomething error might be in dmesg, try 'dmesg | grep -i eth0'
is there a way to get ubuntu to try to discover the hardware again?
not a simple one I know. If you know the name of the driver modulse you can reload it though
weird stuff. And I don't suppose there's a configuration icon for eth1?
there is one, and it looks okay
Can't you connect to the wired network with eth1 then?
I don't really know how to help you ;(. I've got to go right now, maybe you'll have more luck with someone else
